title: Instead of scuttle giving a bunch of gold and exp, it should grant "green buff"
body:
I have two ideas for what green buff could be:

1. Significantly lowers the cooldown on warding-totem/sweeper.

2. Grants an effect similar to Duskblade where you have a kind of permanent ward sense while the buff is active (like smiting raptor camp in season 6).

Share any other ideas for what green buff could be, I'd like to hear them.

replies.body:
It would have to be something a lot weaker than this. Vision control is POWERFUL, and considering there are 2 crabs that are both in contested territory, it would have to be a buff that's one time use so it doesn't make junglers steamroll and ruin vision just because they killed one.
After all, not only does the Scuttler give gold and XP, it also gives you a speedbuff/river ward as well as heals you when you kill it. If those properties are to still exist, you can't have a crazy strong buff too.

Yeah I was thinking in place of the exp and large sum of gold.  Something more balanced as you say.  I think the vision theme goes with the green color so still something vision-oriented.  Vision is hard to quantify though so it's hard to say what would be strong/weak.

It may be specifically hard to quantify, but having vision of more of the map allows you to have awareness of the enemy team, and thus avoid ganks, know when to take objectives, and when to ambush them. This denies them gold, gives you gold, gives you objectives, and allows you to strategize and plot around your enemies. That's immensely powerful in a fog of war game, even if it's not easily quantifiable. Denying enemies those advantages that vision offers is STRONG, because vision is the #1 way to avoid death in this game.
I'm actually in agreement with you that vision is very powerful.  I just meant it's hard to quantify, therefore its hard to formulate what a balanced vision buff would be.

Well, it would have to be something like the passive of Duskblade - a one and done deal that has enough time to block and let you clear one ward, maybe 2, and that's it.

> Well, it would have to be something like the passive of Duskblade - a one and done deal that has enough time to block and let you clear one ward, maybe 2, and that's it.

Yeah I could see that being balanced.

Just spitballing here but what if it reduced the cooldown of totem/sweeper by something like 50% and increased the duration of any wards/sweeps by 15%?  This would mean at level 1, over the course of the 2 minute buff, you would regenerate 1 full warding totem charge (instead of half a charge), and a ward placed during the buff would last 104 seconds (instead of 90.)  If you have sweeper instead, you will regenerate 2.6 sweeps (instead of 1.3), with each sweep lasting 11.5 seconds (instead of 10).  If you had farsight alteration, you would regenerate 1.2 charges (instead of 0.6), and it would reveal an area for 5.75 seconds (instead of 5).

Maybe those numbers are a bit high but that seems like another angle a vision buff could take.
